description:
There is a race condition in list_instances which can cause InstanceNotFound exceptions to occur.

I'm seeing this happen sometimes when periodic tasks like 'update_available_resource' fire when running test suites like Torpedo and Tempest.

We should update list instances so that it doesn't raise InstanceNotFound exceptions if an instance is deleted while it is running.
title: libvirt list_instances causes libvirtError exception

commit be590cfa4b0025587a956642dc859902d577f3f7
Author: Dan Prince <email address hidden>
Date:   Fri Aug 3 13:04:46 2012 -0400

    Handle InstanceNotFound in libvirt list_instances.
    
    Updates the libvirt driver so that InstanceNotFound is
    handled within the list_instances function. This
    can occur if an instance is deleted while the
    list_instances function is processing.
    
    Fixes LP Bug #1032741.

Almost forgot... here is an example stack trace where this happens:

2012-08-03 14:22:25 ERROR nova.manager [-] Error during ComputeManager.update_available_resource: Domain not found: no domain with matching id 10
2012-08-03 14:22:25 TRACE nova.manager Traceback (most recent call last):
2012-08-03 14:22:25 TRACE nova.manager   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nova/manager.py", line 173, in periodic_tasks
2012-08-03 14:22:25 TRACE nova.manager     task(self, context)
2012-08-03 14:22:25 TRACE nova.manager   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nova/compute/manager.py", line 2790, in update_available_resource
2012-08-03 14:22:25 TRACE nova.manager     self.driver.update_available_resource(context, self.host)
2012-08-03 14:22:25 TRACE nova.manager   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py", line 2220, in update_available_resource
2012-08-03 14:22:25 TRACE nova.manager     'disk_available_least': self.get_disk_available_least()}
2012-08-03 14:22:25 TRACE nova.manager   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py", line 2713, in get_disk_available_least
2012-08-03 14:22:25 TRACE nova.manager     instances_name = self.list_instances()
2012-08-03 14:22:25 TRACE nova.manager   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py", line 414, in list_instances
2012-08-03 14:22:25 TRACE nova.manager     if x != 0]  # We skip domains with ID 0 (hypervisors).
2012-08-03 14:22:25 TRACE nova.manager   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/eventlet/tpool.py", line 187, in doit
2012-08-03 14:22:25 TRACE nova.manager     result = proxy_call(self._autowrap, f, *args, **kwargs)
2012-08-03 14:22:25 TRACE nova.manager   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/eventlet/tpool.py", line 147, in proxy_call
2012-08-03 14:22:25 TRACE nova.manager     rv = execute(f,*args,**kwargs)
2012-08-03 14:22:25 TRACE nova.manager   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/eventlet/tpool.py", line 76, in tworker
2012-08-03 14:22:25 TRACE nova.manager     rv = meth(*args,**kwargs)
2012-08-03 14:22:25 TRACE nova.manager   File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/libvirt.py", line 2594, in lookupByID
2012-08-03 14:22:25 TRACE nova.manager     if ret is None:raise libvirtError('virDomainLookupByID() failed', conn=self)

----

Looks like my initial patch got this wrong. We need to catch libvirtError (which gets thrown by lookupByID).
